alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:48PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Johnston, southwestern Seminole, central Pontotoc and central Pottawatomie Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 548 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Reagan to near Fittstown to 3 miles south of Konawa to 4 miles east of Brooksville. Movement was east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ada, Tecumseh, Tishomingo, Konawa, Byng, Maud, Earlsboro, Ravia, Stonewall, Milburn, Fitzhugh, St. Louis, Brooksville, Pontotoc, Fittstown, Reagan, Connerville, Jesse and Harjo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
